revised_title: The Sensation of Light Produced by Radium Rays and Its Relation to Visual Purple
tldr: The authors investigate the sensation of light produced by radium rays and find that it is not due to a direct response of the retina. Instead, they conclude that the sensation is caused by light rays emitted by the tissues of the eyeball, such as the cornea and lens, when they are traversed by alpha and beta rays from the radium.
